x:product.name: Evaluation_License
x:product.x:title: Evaluation_License
x:product.x:abstract: This licence enables you to access ELF products and services for the purpose of evaluating its suitability only. It is a time limited licence.

x:parameter.name: LICENSE_TEXT_000_Evaluation License Agreement
x:parameter.x:title: Evaluation License Agreement
x:parameter.x:value:
European Location Framework Evaluation Licence Agreement
Between: Eurogeographics …etc Hereafter the ‘‘ELF Platform manager’’ Or ‘‘The Licensor’’
And : The person or organisation who has registered for and accepted this licence or who accesses the ELF Evaluation Products . (You, Your) hereafter “the Licensee”
1. This Agreement
1.1. Each party shall be referred to as “a Party”, both parties may be referred to as “the Parties”. They have agreed to accept this agreement (hereafter “the Agreement”). This Agreement sets out the agreement and understanding between the Parties.
2. Definitions
Term Definition Agreement means the agreement as described in Clause 1 & 3 Confidential Information means any information that is marked or identified as confidential, or that would reasonably be considered to be confidential in nature, that relates to the affairs of a party and is acquired by the other party in anticipation of or as a result of the Agreement. Contractor
ELF means any contractor engaged by you or tendering to provide goods or services to the Licensee in connection with ELF Data means the European Location Framework ELF Evaluation Product ELF Product version of ELF Product available for Evaluation purposes under the terms of this licence means the products offered for licence via the ELF platform ELF Platform Manager legal entity responsible for the operations of the ELF Platform ELF Terms of Service
Fair Use means the description of technical and administrative service levels of the ELF Evaluation Products is a description of the usage levels of the ELF Evaluation Product under the terms of this licence Force Majeure
Initial term any cause preventing a Party from performing any or all of its obligations which arises from or is attributable to acts, events, omissions or accidents beyond the reasonable control of the Party. means a period of three (3) months from the date you accept the licence terms in this Agreement IPR (Intellectual Property Rights) means intellectual property rights, including copyright, patent, trade mark, design right, database rights, trade secrets, know how, rights of confidence and all other similar rights anywhere in the world whether or not registered and including applications for registration of any of them. ELF Licensed Use means your permitted use of ELF Evaluation Product in accordance with clause 2 of this agreement
Technical Specification
Term means the technical characteristics of an ELF product or service at the point of availability or delivery to an End User, as referred to in the product annexes to this agreement means the Initial term and any extended term of this Agreement as set out in clause 3
3. Application of this Agreement
3.1. The Agreement sets out the terms and conditions applicable to your use of the ELF Evaluation Product for the purposes identified in this agreement 3.2. The Agreement is governed by, and will be construed in accordance with Belgian Law. 3.3. Subject to your acceptance of these terms, we agree to supply you with or enable access to the ELF Evaluation Product for an Initial Term of 3 months, extendable upon renewal up to a maximum of 12 months, unless otherwise agreed in writing
4. ELF Licensed Use
4.1. We grant you a non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable licence for the evaluation of ELF Evaluation Product during the Term solely for the purposes of ELF Licensed Use in this agreement 4.2. ELF Licensed Use means; 4.3. Evaluating , testing and demonstrating the capabilities of the ELF Evaluation Product internally in your organisation under this Agreement 4.4. You may, with our prior permission use the ELF Evaluation Product in the day to day activities involved in the administration and running of your business 4.5. Provided that you have already entered into a sub-contractor licence (which include terms not inconsistent with this agreement) you may enable access to the ELF Evaluation Product to your sub- contractor for the purposes set out in clause 4.2
5. Fair Use
5.1. Your use of the ELF Evaluation Product is subject to the ELF Product and Service Fair use policy 5.2. By accessing the ELF Evaluation Product under the terms of this agreement you are accepting that your use is restricted to the policy 5.3. If you are found to be exceeding the limit under this policy, on a consistent basis, the Licensor reserves the right to limit your access to the Product until such time as the Licensor has contacted you to discuss your usage requirements
6. Your Obligations
6.1. You shall have no other rights to use the ELF Evaluation Product or any ELF trademark for any purposes than those detailed in clause 4 6.2. You shall ensure that access to or use of ELF Evaluation Products, licensed to you are secure from unauthorised use 6.3. You shall notify us as you become aware of or suspect any infringement or unauthorised use , or any breach of the intellectual property rights in the ELF Evaluation Product and/or trademarks. You agree to co-operate in pursuing or dealing with such infringement 6.4. You may not; 6.4.1. Remove or alter any trademark, brand or notice on IPR included by ELF contained within the ELF Evaluation Product 6.4.2. Assign, or transfer all or parts of its rights and obligations under this Agreement 6.4.3. Use the ELF Evaluation Product to recreate any ELF product, any part of such products or substantially similar one or; 6.4.4. Sell, licence or distribute the ELF Evaluation Product.
7. Intellectual Property Rights
7.1. The Licensee acknowledges that the IPR in the ELF Evaluation Product, and any and all data and software provided, including improvements or modifications is owned by the data providers to the ELF Platform. No IPR are transferred or assigned to the Licensee under this Agreement and all rights not explicitly licensed to the End User are reserved
8. Confidentiality
8.1. The parties will take all reasonable steps to ensure that any Confidential Information which the other party has declared as such, will not be disclosed to others, in whole or part, without the prior written consent of the other party
9. Liability
9.1. The ELF Evaluation Product is provided ‘as is’ and without any warranty or condition express or implied as to its quality of fitness for purpose. 9.2. Except as stated all conditions, warranties, terms in respect of the ELF Evaluation Product are hereby excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law 9.3. Subject to clause 7.4, under no circumstances shall we be liable for any loss which occurs as a result of the use of or lack of performance of the ELF Evaluation Product. 9.4. Neither party excludes its respective liability to the other under this Agreement for fraud, personal injury and death caused by its negligence and that of its respective employees and subcontractors
10. Variation
10.1 Either party may at any time propose changes to this agreement 10.2 Any proposed change will only come into effect if agreed by both parties
11. Termination
11.1 We may terminate this agreement immediately if: 11.1.1 You breach its terms 11.1.2 Your are subject to insolvency, bankruptcy or administration 11.1.3 You cease to do business 11.1.4 We give you 30 days written notice of any other reason 11.2 From the date of expiry or termination of the licence granted in clause 2, you and your sub-contractors must immediately cease use of the ELF Evaluation Product including all data, software and other intellectual property associated with the ELF Evaluation Product that you have accessed under the terms of this licence 11.3 Should you enter into a further ELF licence, you may retain your existing access to the ELF Evaluation product provided that; 11.3.1 The commencement date of such licence must fall before the date that this Agreement terminates; and 11.3.2 The ELF Evaluation Product is representative of the same ELF data and coverage as is licensed under the new licence

x:parameter.name: ALL_ROLES
x:parameter.x:title: Indicates if product is supported for all groups
x:parameter.x:abstract: Will be set to true if all groups are supported, else value will be set to false

x:parameter.name: ALLOWED_ROLES
x:parameter.x:title: Roles for this license product
x:parameter.x:abstract: The roles that are able to see this license product

x:parameter.name: LICENSE-TAX-RATE
x:parameter.x:title: The current license tax rate in percent

x:parameter.name: PRICE_MATRIX_http://wms.geonorge.no/skwms1/wms.elf\x5Fadmin\x5Fbasemap_GET
x:parameter.x:title: Price for resource http://wms.geonorge.no/skwms1/wms.elf_admin_basemap and operation GET.

x:parameter.name: PRICE_MATRIX_http://wms.geonorge.no/skwms1/wms.elf\x5Fadmin\x5Fbasemap_POST
x:parameter.x:title: Price for resource http://wms.geonorge.no/skwms1/wms.elf_admin_basemap and operation POST.

x:parameter.name: SERVICE_TYPE
x:parameter.x:title: The technical type of the service

x:parameter.name: SERVICE_RESOURCES
x:parameter.x:title: All resources available for this service

x:parameter.name: LICENSE_DURATION
x:parameter.x:title: Duration of license validity, choosable by the user

x:parameter.name: LICENSE_USER_GROUP
x:parameter.x:title: The group of the user
x:parameter.x:abstract: This must be set automatical by the license client and not to show in the GUI

x:parameter.name: LICENSE_USER_ID
x:parameter.x:title: The id of the user
x:parameter.x:abstract: This must be set automatical by the license client and not to show in the GUI

x:parameter.name: LICENSE_USER_TYPE
x:parameter.x:title: Which scope shall have the license
x:parameter.x:abstract: If only one value is present (static choice during configuration in license-editor) than the value may not be shown in the license client
